descriptive_summary.prefercite: 2007ms058: [identification of item], Kentucky Association of Family and Consumer Sciences records, 1929-2007, undated, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Kentucky Association of Family and Consumer Sciences first formed under the name Kentucky Home Economics Association (KHEA) formed in 1922 as an Affiliate of the American Home Economics Association. The organization encourages research, education, and career development in areas like personal finance, diet and fitness, child and elder care, apparel design and production, and consumer affairs.The Kentucky Home Economics Association has partnered with colleges and universities throughout the commonwealth to provide resurces for students studying home economics professional development for members working in the field. It has also given awards and scholarships for active members and students in support of their achievements. KHEA formed central, eastern, and western districts to support members locally. Additionally, sections were formed with areas of focus like the Home Economics in Business (HEIB) section and Student Member chapters and clubs. In 1994, the AHEA changed its name to the American Association of Family and Consumer Sciences. The following year Kentucky chapter adopted the name Kentucky Association of Family and Consumer Sciences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Kentucky Association of Family and Consumer Sciences (KAFCS) records, (dated 1929-2007, undated; 7.23 cubic feet; 18 boxes; 127 megabytes and 150 digital files) comprise administrative files; executive, section, and committee reports; newsletters; and publications, which document the history of Kentucky's affiliate of the American Association of Family and Consumer Sciences. The collection also includes awards, event programs, event and member photographs and artifacts representing the support of KAFCS' mission as a professional development organization.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Audiovisual materials and photographs series primarily consists of photographs, from the mid 1960s through to the early 2000s, of Kentucky Association of Family and Consumer Sciences members and annual meetings. The bulk of the series consists of small format photographic prints, ink jet printer images, and digital photographs that were originally housed on compact disks. Also included is a microcasette audio recording of a former president of KAFCS reviewing duties for the incoming president and an educational film on vhs tape about careers in home economics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Administrative files series comprises official documents for the KAFCS, such as the articles of incorporation and by-laws, board of director's meeting minutes, financial budgets and ledgers, and the KAFCS annual meeting reports. The series also includes reports created by the excutive secretary, committees, districts and sections like Home Economics in Business (HEIB), and the Student Member Section. Reports include activites of various entities of KAFCS like officer elections, event plans, and yearly summaries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Organizational history and artifacts series comprises books and reports about the history of the American Association of Family and Consumer Sciences and the Kentucky Association of Family and Consumer Sciences. Also, included is information about members, such as directories, award nominations, and scholarship lists. Additionally, the series contains event programs, event keepsakes, and other artifacts like medals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Publications series primarily consists of newsletters created and published by the Kentucky Association of Family and Consumer Sciences, the Home Economics in Business Section, and the Kentucky Student Member section. Also included are newsletters of the American Association of Family and Consumer Sciences and the National Magazine Home Economics Student Clubs. The Publications series also contains has some books about significant home economics leaders and Kentucky newspaper clippings about KAFCS members.
